commentBody:
From an article in Monday's NYTimes: "... in grades nine through 12."

Why not this?: ... in Grades 9 through 12 (or Grades 9-12, or even "in 9th through 12th grades).

For a long, long time, when an ordinal-number something, such as "10th grade", is written as a cardinal number, the ordinality is preserved by uppercasing, thus "Grade 10" here.

Looks like there's something to be said about the expression "born yesterday", namely that it is accurate with respect to those who would write something like "grade 10" for "10th grade". (Hmmm...Wonder if the AP has influenced The Times here...)
